quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bowies, midnight. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which movie did the Rat Packers vie for the title of Gambling King?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Four For Texas

questions.question: Which Rolling Stones hit was rumored to be about Mick Jaggers affair with David Bowies wife?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toto

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guinnevere

options.text: d then Georgie would make the fire lights,

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbara Ann

options.text: d he was taken from africa, brought to america,

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fighting for survival

options.text: d I started out of town, yeah!
l of a sudden I saw Sheriff John Brown
If I am guilty I will pay

options.text: For the Love of the Game

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: John Williams and Composer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, intellectuals. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: John Williams composed the Oscar-winning score for this World War II movie.

options.text: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schindlers List

questions.question: Which Romantic composer wrote the Roman Carnival Overture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Berlioz

questions.question: This epic score, composed by John Williams, is from what 1993 Spielberg film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jurassic Park

questions.question: The score for which of the following movies was not composed by John Williams?

options.text: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

questions.question: The Russian Five, considered the great musical intellectuals of the 19th century included Balakirev, Cui, Mussorgsky, Borodin and this composer who wrote the opera The Tale of Tsar Saltan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rimsky-Korsakov

questions.question: Who composed the ballet score Rodeo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Copland

questions.question: Is it true that Edward Elgar was a British composer who wrote The Enigma Variations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The sixth symphony of this Bonn-bred composer was nicknamed Pastoral.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beethoven

questions.question: The music for this movie about Peter Pan was composed by John Williams .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hook

questions.question: John Williams wrote the score for this SciFi movie, directed by Steven Spielberg.

options.text: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial

questions.question: Finlandia is one of the most famous pieces by this composer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sibelius

questions.question: Brahms fifth symphony was also his last.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Don Giovanni is an opera in two acts by what popular composer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mozart

questions.question: What is the name of this track composed by John Williams, and what movie is it from?

options.text: Opening Theme; Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope
The Flag Parade; Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace
Imperial March; Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back
Raiders March; Raiders of the Lost Arc

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Imperial March; Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back

questions.question: What was the name of the Hungarian composer who wrote the Hary Janos Suite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kodaly
